Conditions

Class Disjunction

  • java.lang.Object
    • Conditions.ComposedCondition
      • Conditions.Disjunction
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Condition

    public class Disjunction
extends ComposedCondition
    A class of composed conditions treating their subcommands as a disjunction of conditions. That is, a disjunction evaluates to true if at least one of its subconditions does so.
    Version:
    3.0
    Author:
    Brecht Gosselé & William Mauclet 2BiR: wtk-cws (Gosselé) en cws-elt(Mauclet)

      Create a new disjunction with the given subconditions.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Disjunction

        public Disjunction(java.util.ArrayList<Condition> conditions)
        Create a new disjunction with the given subconditions.
        Parameters:
        conditions - The list of conditions that will be the subconditions of this new disjunction.

    • Method Detail

      • evaluate

        public boolean evaluate(Robot robot)
        Evaluates this disjunction.
        Specified by:
        evaluate in interface Condition
        Specified by:
        evaluate in class ComposedCondition
        Parameters:
        robot - The robot for which to evaluate the subconditions.
        Returns:
        A boolean true if at least one of this disjunction's subconditions evaluates to true. A boolean false if not.

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Returns a string representation of this disjunction.
        Specified by:
        toString in interface Condition
        Specified by:
        toString in class ComposedCondition
        Returns:
        A string representation of this disjunction, namely the word "or", followed by the respective string representations of all the subconditions, and the whole enclosed by brackets.
